arm_group.description: home polysomnography (GETEMED) and standard polysomnography (BRAINNETII) are both carried out in children during 1 night.

brief_summary.textblock:
It is often clinically impossible to differentiate children with an isolated snoring from
      those with OSA. The diagnosis of OSA is currently based on nocturnal, laboratory-based
      polysomnography. This expensive examination is poorly accessible due to appointments delays
      at hospital.

      Our study is designed to compare the characteristics of a home polysomnography versus
      standard polysomnography for the diagnosis of pediatric OSA.

clinical_study.brief_title: Obstructive Sleep Apnea Syndrome (OSA) and Getemed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male and female subjects, aged 2 to 6 years old, requiring a polysomnography or
             admitted for intense snoring or suspected sleep apnea

          -  Parents must have signed the inform consent form and be covered by the National
             Health Insurance Program.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Parents opposed to the study.

facility.name: Hospices Civils de Lyon- Hôpital Femme Mère Enfant

clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Characteristics of a Home Polysomnograph for the Diagnosis of Patients With Obstructive Sleep Apnea Syndrome - A Pilot Study

overall_official.affiliation: Hospices Civils de Lyon- Hôpital Femme Mère Enfant

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description:
Standard polysomnography considered pathological if obstructive apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) > 5 / hr.
Home polysomongraphy considered pathological if at least one of the following criteria is present :
Respiratory Disturbance Index (RDI) > 10 / hr + /- Desaturation Index > 4% for more than 2.5 / hr.
Brouillette index ; pulse wave  > 3 desaturation clusters and > 3 desaturation <90%.
primary_outcome.measure: Characteristics of a home polysomnograph versus standard polysomnography for the diagnosis of OSA in children.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine polygraphic pathological criteria by comparing the RDI per hour of the home polysomnography versus the (AHI) of the standard polysomnography.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
